Detailed Description

Device iterator implementation for virtual root storage device.

Class RootStorageDeviceIterator implements the device iterator for the virtual root storage device. This class should be used if the RootStorageDevice should not be returned by the iterator. This is needed for example when the free volume size for the registered devices should be retrieved. Since the RootStorageDevice is only a virtual one it cannot have a volume size.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RootStorageDeviceIterator::RootStorageDeviceIterator (  const StorageDeviceFilterPtr &  filter  ) 
 

Constructs a root storage device iterator. The iterator retrieves storage devices which comply to filter. This is the only constructor since a non-initialized storage device iterator is not allowed.

Parameters:
filter A storage device filter functor.

RootStorageDeviceIterator::~RootStorageDeviceIterator (   ) 
 

Member Function Documentation

StorageDeviceIterator & RootStorageDeviceIterator::AtomicIncrement (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Increments the iterator to point to the next storage device registered to the root file system and returns a reference to itself. This increment operation does not consider the filter set on construction. Only valid iterators are allowed to be incremented. If this method gets called on the end iterator an assertion holds.

Returns:
Reference to itself incremented to point to the next storage device or being the end iterator.

Reimplemented from StorageDeviceIterator.

BOOLEAN RootStorageDeviceIterator::IsValid (   )  const [virtual]
 

Tells if the iterator points to a storage device. This is determined by simply checking the current storage device smart-pointer. If it wraps 0 it is not valid, otherwise it is valid.

Returns:
Tells if the iterator is valid.

Reimplemented from StorageDeviceIterator.
